ngiemboon: Megàŋmbù pà Yúndà pâ pe pʉ̀a Mbɛŋjÿamɛŋ la júʼ ngie pakÿo láʼ pie é ka piŋ nzèm ne ńkwɛ́ɛ ndá Ssé, é Ssé pa Ésàlayɛ,
en: When the enemies of Judah and Benjamin   heard that the returned exiles  # 4:1 Lit the sons of the exile,# 4:1 Ezr 1:11; 2:1 were building a temple for the Lord, the God of Israel,

ngiemboon: ńgʉa ńgyá Zolombambɛɛ pâ mefùɔ tsìŋendá, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Peg ne ńkwoŋo lékẅéte gẅí lékwɛ́ yɔɔn ndá Ssé! Mbɔɔ púʼu, tà fó páʼ fùɔ Asalandoŋ la túmo wég ńnáa jʉʼɔɔn, pege ee ńguʼte pɔ́ tàʼ Ssé, ḿbiŋe ńnuŋe pwɔʼ pɔ́ mvfò yé.»
en: they approached Zerubbabel and the family heads and said to them, “Let us build with you, for we also worship your God and have been sacrificing to him   since the time King Esar-haddon of Assyria brought us here.”  # 4:2 2Kg 17:24,27–32; 19:37; Is 37:38

ngiemboon: Táʼ, Zolobabɛ̂ɛ pɔ́ Yǒonshûa, ńgÿo petsɔ́ mefùɔ tsìŋendá pa Ésàlayɛ tsɔ́ʼ né pɔ́b ngie: «Á te ne ńzɛ́te ngie pege púte ńkwɛ́ ndá gie ée ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a yeg wɔ́. Peg gíle peg zɔ ge kwɛ́. Ńtí nue e ge gÿo gwɔ́ ndá Ssé, é Ssé pa Ésàlayɛ, páʼ Silẅísè gẅie aa fùɔ pʉ̀a Pɛ́ɛsè la tsẅi púʼu.»
en: But Zerubbabel, Jeshua, and the other heads of Israel’s families answered them, “You may have no part with us in building a house for our God,   since we alone will build it for the Lord, the God of Israel, as King Cyrus, the king of Persia has commanded us.”  # 4:3 Ezr 1:1–4

ngiemboon: Á cʉa púʼu, epʉ̀a láʼ zye lémaʼ metsẅiŋ na pʉ̀a Yúndà légwɔ́ gie pɔ́ té kwɛ́ ndá Ssé wɔ́.
en: Then the people who were already in the land   discouraged  # 4:4 Lit weakened the hands of the people of Judah and made them afraid  # 4:4 Ezr 3:3 to build.

ngiemboon: Megàŋmbù la ná nkáb né panántÿɔgɔ́ mbwó fùɔ, légwɔ́ gie pɔ́ tsẅiŋe lɔ́ɔn na fàʼ gie mé ka ne ńkwaŋa léfaʼa fʉ̀ʼ gie Silẅísè la ne sáʼa láʼ, ńgʉa ńkú fʉ̀ʼ gie Ndalẅísè la kúbe twó yé ńcʉ́ʼʉ fùɔ Pɛ́ɛsè.
en: They also bribed officials to act against them to frustrate their plans   throughout the reign of King Cyrus of Persia and until the reign of King Darius of Persia.  # 4:5 Ezr 5:5; 6:1

ngiemboon: Á laa fʉ̀ʼ gie fùɔ Zɛɛzɛ́sè la zye lésáʼa láʼ, megàŋmbù ŋweʼe tsɔ́ ŋwàʼne lélɔg ńdaʼ pʉ̀a Yúndà mbɔɔ pʉ̀a Yelúzálèm.
en: At the beginning of the reign of Ahasuerus,   the people who were already in the land  # 4:6 Ezr 3:3 wrote an accusation against the residents of Judah and Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Á laa fʉ̀ʼ gie Atasesɛ̂ɛ la ne sáʼa láʼ, Mbishÿelam pâ Mitelendad lâ Tambɛɛ, mbɔɔ pfwɔ̀ʼɔ pʉ̀a pie pâ pɔ́ faʼa, é ŋweʼe ŋwàʼne ńnáa mbwó Atasesɛ̂ɛ gẅie aa fùɔ pʉ̀a Pɛ́ɛsè. Mé la lɔg pɔ́ shwóŋè pʉ̀a Alam ńŋweʼe ŋwàʼne, ḿbiŋ ńgíŋ ńdɔg pɔ́ shwóŋè pʉ̀a Alam ŋwɛ́ ńkyagte.
en: During the time of King Artaxerxes of Persia,   Bishlam, Mithredath, Tabeel and the rest of his colleagues wrote to King Artaxerxes. The letter was written in Aramaic  # 4:7 Dn 1:4; 2:4 and translated.  # 4:7 Ezr 4:8–6:18 is written in Aramaic.

ngiemboon: Lehum gẅie aa ngúmnɔ̀ɔn tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ pàga láʼ, pɔ́ Shimshÿayii gẅie à laa ntẅènzóŋ, pɔ́ gíŋ ńŋweʼe yɔ́b ŋwàʼne, ńnáa mbwó fùɔ Atasesɛ̂ɛ, ńtí Yelúzálèm. Pɔ́ la zyete yɔɔn ŋwàʼne ngie:
en: Rehum the chief deputy and Shimshai the scribe   wrote a letter to King Artaxerxes concerning Jerusalem as follows:

ngiemboon: «Yɔɔn áa ŋwàʼne Lehum gẅie aa ngúmnɔ̀ɔn pàga láʼ, pɔ́ Shimshÿayii gẅie aa ntẅènzóŋ pâ pfwɔ̀ʼɔ pʉ̀a pie pâ pɔ́ faʼa, é pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ láʼa Ndîŋ, mbɔɔ pie ée Afasatag, né pie ée Taapɛle, né pie ée Afalásè, né pie ée Ɛleg, né pie ée Mbambilonia, né pie ée Súsè, né pie ée Ndefa, né pie ée Elam.
en: From Rehum   the chief deputy, Shimshai the scribe, and the rest of their colleagues #— #the judges and magistrates  # 4:9 Or ambassadors from Tripolis, Persia, Erech, Babylon, Susa  # 4:9 Neh 1:1; Est 1:2; Dn 8:2 (that is, the people of Elam),  # 4:9 Aramaic obscure

ngiemboon: Peg lɔ̌g mbɔɔ mezíŋ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a pie Osenapaa gẅie aa máanyìŋ mé zsé yé tɛʼ, à la gwoon wɔ́b ńdɔg ńkÿo láʼ, ńgÿo pɔ́ gʉa ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋo Samalîɛ, mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ gwoŋó pàga láʼ gie á laa shÿó mbyěnèm we mí Efelad, ńnyé ńtyé sẅɛ̀ɛ.»
en: and the rest of the peoples whom the great and illustrious Ashurbanipal   deported and settled in the cities of Samaria  # 4:10 2Kg 17:24 and the region west of the Euphrates River.  # 4:10–11 Ezr 4:16–17,20

ngiemboon: Jʉ́jʉ́ŋ ŋwàʼne gie pɔ́ túm ngie mé náa mbwó fùɔ Atasesɛ̂ɛ à wɔɔn: «Peg megàŋafàʼ pú, é pʉ̀a pie ée shÿó mbyěnèm we mí Efalad, tà mbɔɔ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a.
en: This is the text of the letter they sent to him:

ngiemboon: Á poŋ ngie fùɔ zsé ngie pà Yúndà pie é ka fó láʼ gù, ńtó tà ńkúu tsetsɛ̀ɛ peg á Yelúzálèm, pɔ́ gíŋ ńne ńkwɛ́ɛ tÿǒsoŋ gie patʉʉ twó pâ pʉ̀a tepòŋ zɔ̌ɔ wó, pɔ́ ne siŋte mecÿó ndá, ńne ḿbwóon mesǎg ndá.
en: Let it be known to the king that the Jews who came from you have returned to us at Jerusalem. They are rebuilding that rebellious and evil city, finishing its walls, and repairing its foundations.

ngiemboon: Á poŋ ngie fùɔ zsé ngie, mé lɔɔn ńgíŋ ńkwɛ́ɛ yɔɔn tÿǒsoŋ ŋwɛ́, ḿbiŋ ńgíŋ ńnyɛte mesǎg ndá mie ée wó, mbà pɔ́ te gíŋ péen ncùb wɔ́, é ké le gíŋ ḿbéen mánzsè tá ńcʉa wɔ́, é ké le gíŋ ḿbéen tsɔ́ mencùb wɔ́, pɔ́ ge gÿo púʼu, à gÿo ńcʉ́ʼ nzsòzsò, ńtsẅɛ́te nkáb gie e kúu tsɛ̀ɛ kʉbé fùɔ.
en: Let it now be known to the king that if that city is rebuilt and its walls are finished,   they will not pay tribute, duty, or land tax,  # 4:13 Ezr 4:20; 7:24 and the royal revenue  # 4:13 Aramaic obscure will suffer.

ngiemboon: Páʼ lefaʼa mbwó gù aa mbwó peg ńgwɔ́ mekùʼ la, ngwɔ́ peg le zẅíŋ ngie mé lɔgɔ gú shwoŋ ssé wɔ́. Áa mmó gie á gÿǒ, peg gÿo afùɔ zsé mɔɔn menò.
en: Since we have taken an oath of loyalty to the king,   and it is not right for us to witness his dishonor, we have sent to inform the king

ngiemboon: Légwɔ́ gie mé gʉa tsɛ̀ɛ lepuʼú ŋwàʼne gie á laʼte menò mie é lǎ cʉate tsɛ̀ɛ láʼ, éfaʼ. Mé ge líe, é gyá páʼ tÿǒsoŋo Yelúzálèm áa ńké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ patʉʉ twó. Áa ńké ńtsẅé ńnéŋe mefùɔ pâ mengúmnɔ̀ɔn pàga láʼ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ menò, tà fó fʉ̀ʼʉmvfò, ayɔɔn tÿǒsoŋ ŋwɛ́ tʉ pɔ́ twó, yɔɔn áa mmó gie á la gÿo tá mé pyág.
en: that a search should be made in your predecessors’ record books.   In these record books you will discover and verify that the city is a rebellious city, harmful to kings and provinces. There have been revolts in it since ancient times. That is why this city was destroyed.

ngiemboon: Peg faʼa léshwóŋo fùɔ ngie: Mé lɔɔn ńzɔɔn ńgíŋ ńkwɛ́ɛ yɔɔn tÿǒsoŋ kwɛ́, ńgíŋ ńnyɛte mbɔɔ metʉ́ankáʼ mie ée wó, mbà ɔ̀ těen ńdáʼa ńgíŋe ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à tseen pʉ̀a á shÿó mbyěnèm we mí Efalad wɔ́.»
en: We advise the king that if this city is rebuilt and its walls are finished, you will not have any possession west of the Euphrates.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ la tsɔ́ʼɔ piŋé ŋwàʼne yɔ́b ńgɔɔn ngie: «Mèŋ n náa páʼɔɔn mbwó Lehum, á ngúmnɔ̀ɔn, á mbwó Shimshÿayii gẅie aa ndèʼe ntsèm we, ḿbiŋ ńgÿo pfwɔ̀ʼɔ kwò yɔ́b gie á tsẅé ngwòŋ Samalîɛ, mbɔɔ gie á tsẅé shÿó mbyěnèm we mí Efalad. Mèŋ n tsyɛ́ʼte gẅí, té zɔ́g ńtyɛʼte.
en: The king sent a reply to his chief deputy Rehum, Shimshai the scribe, and the rest of their colleagues living in Samaria and elsewhere in the region west of the Euphrates River:

ngiemboon: Aŋwàʼne gie pi ka tǔm ńná né peg, mé la tóŋ, ńkyagte éshwóŋo wɔ́ɔn.
en: The letter you sent us has been translated and read  ,# 4:18 Neh 8:8 in my presence.

ngiemboon: N ka tǔm ngie mé gʉa ńtúŋte éfaʼ, mé ka faʼ, ńgyá ngie tà fó fʉ̀ʼʉmvfò, epʉ̀a tÿǒsoŋ yɔɔn ké ńdɔg pɔ́ ndʉʼʉ́ ndʉʼʉ́ ńtó ne mefùɔ, ḿmaʼ pɔ́ tág, ḿbiŋ ńtʉ pɔ́ twó.
en: I issued a decree and a search was conducted. It was discovered that this city has had uprisings against kings since ancient times, and there have been rebellions and revolts in it.

ngiemboon: Á laa tsɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ, mefùɔ pie é gẅiin ngʉ̀ʼ gwɔ́ Yelúzálèm. Pɔ́ zɔ̌ lɔ́ɔn ḿbúu sáʼa pàga láʼ gie áa shÿó mbyěnèm we mí Efalad, mé piŋe ḿbéen nzsè, ḿbéen ncùb mbɔɔ tsɔ́ mencùb pɔ́ mbwó pɔ́b.
en: Powerful kings have also ruled over Jerusalem and exercised authority over the whole region west of the Euphrates River, and tribute, duty, and land tax were paid to them.

ngiemboon: Á piŋ ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼɔɔn páʼɔɔn, ńne ńzɛ́te ngie pi tsẅi né pʉ̀a Yúndà ngie pɔ́ kyɛ mefàʼ ńnyé. N dɔɔn té láʼ ńtsẅi ngie mé kwɛ́ɛ tÿǒsoŋ wɔ́, mbà mé té gíŋ ńkwɛ́ wɔ́.
en: Therefore, issue an order for these men to stop, so that this city will not be rebuilt until a further decree has been pronounced by me.

ngiemboon: Pi pɔ́ɔn le gwágte yɔɔn nò. Á té ne ńzɛ́te ngie nò tepòŋ kẅiʼi ńgyɔ́ɔn, ńnéŋ ngɔ́ʼ na mefùɔ wɔ́.»
en: See that you not neglect this matter. Otherwise, the damage will increase and the royal interests   will suffer.

ngiemboon: Mé la leen ńtóŋo ŋwàʼne fùɔ Atasesɛ̂ɛ mvfò Lehum pɔ́ Shimshÿayii, ntẅènzóŋ, mbɔɔ yetsɔ́ ngàŋakwò yɔ́b, pɔ́ leen ńdwo ńdu ssé pɔ́ lê tʉ̀ ńgʉa Yelúzálèm mvfò pʉ̀a Yúndà ńdɔg pɔ́ tʉ̀ ńtɔʼɔ wɔ́b légíŋe ńdɔg mefàʼ ńgʉa mvfò.
en: As soon as the text of King Artaxerxes’s letter was read to Rehum, Shimshai the scribe, and their colleagues,   they immediately went to the Jews in Jerusalem and forcibly stopped them.

ngiemboon: Á la cʉa púʼu, afàʼa ndá Ssé Yelúzálèm tyé. Á la ké ńdáʼ ńtyé tyé tà ńkúu na ngùʼ mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a, léfó fʉ̀ʼ gie Ndalẅísè gẅie aa fùɔ Pɛ́ɛsè la zye lésáʼa láʼ.
en: Now the construction of God’s house in Jerusalem had stopped and remained at a standstill until the second year of the reign of King Darius of Persia.
